    "target_population": "Rural households vulnerable to food insecurity"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "maternal cash transfers",
      "cash_amount": "$20 per month",
      "cash_frequency": "monthly for 24 months",
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "In the third arm, PSNP beneficiary households receive SPIR-II programming and NCGs, supplemented with additional targeted cash transfers to pregnant and lactating women. | Therefore, the third study arm introduces maternal transfers of $20 per month during the child's first 24 months of life to relax possible financial constraints to child feeding."
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["livestock"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "Households in SPIR II kebeles show a high probability of membership in village economic and savings associations; the poorest households targeted for livelihoods grants have received the grants, primarily allocating them to livestock-related activities such as fattening or purchasing more animals."
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "nutrition knowledge",
      "infant and young child feeding practices",
      "child anthropometry",
      "food security",
      "poverty reduction",
      "livelihood outcomes",
      "child development"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "The midline survey focused on assessing implementation fidelity and impacts on infant and young child feeding practices. | The endline assessment is scheduled for 2025, and the focus will be quantifying impacts on child anthropometry and livelihood outcomes. | Anticipating limited impacts on livelihood outcomes in the initial year of implementation, the midline survey focused on a small subset of livelihood indicators. | There is robust evidence of enhanced child development in the same arm."
    ,
    "study_design": "Cluster Randomized Controlled Trial (cRCT)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "The IMPEL SPIR-II impact evaluation employs an experimental design with multiple treatment arms comparing combinations of livelihood and nutrition graduation model programming provided to PSNP beneficiaries relative to a control group receiving only PSNP transfers. | This multi-arm cluster randomized control trial (cRCT) design permits the research team to evaluate the causal impact of both livelihood and nutrition graduation programming in SPIR-II."
    ,
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2022-2025",
    "sample_size": 3015,

    "program_name_citation": "Against this backdrop, the second phase of the Strengthen PSNP Institutions and Resilience (SPIR-II) project aims to enhance livelihoods, increase resilience to shocks, and improve food security and nutrition for rural households vulnerable to food insecurity in Ethiopia.",
